header_summary: Johan Torås Halseth proposes using OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY to manage funds between online and offline users, ensuring security and accessibility. Steven Roose introduces the concept of a TxFieldSelector in a Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP), which allows for selecting data inside a transaction. Gijs van Dam suggests decorrelated payments for analysis purposes. Vincent Palazzo acknowledges an error in his previous email and provides a corrected link. ZmnSCPxj discusses implementing a sidepool using the Decker-Wattenhofer mechanism.

recent_posts.title: Solving CoinPool high-interactivity issue with cut-through update of Taproot leaves
recent_posts.summary:
- Johan suggests that OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY may achieve what Antoine is looking for.
- He explains a method using dynamic data and two outputs to manage funds.
- Offline users' funds remain secure and accessible when they come back online.

recent_posts.title: Sidepools For Improving Payment Reliability At Scale
recent_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj discusses the implementation of a sidepool using the Decker-Wattenhofer mechanism.
- They mention the numbers to consider, such as stages, steps per stage, and blocks per step.
- The purpose of the sidepools mechanism is to balance channels and avoid daily on-chain transactions.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- Storage for blockchain is not limited based on factors like block size and time.
- With a 5TB hard drive costing less than $150, storage can last 21 years.
- Optimization efforts and affordable hardware ensure storage remains sufficient for practical usage.

active_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
active_posts.summary:
- Signature-based factories have limitations, but covenants like CTV or APO can solve them.
- Simple covenants enable the creation of Lightning channels without requiring users' signatures.
- Timeout-trees and FFO-WF protocol can improve scalability and enable off-chain transactions in Lightning.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has proposed core opcodes for MATT, improving its functionality in bitcoin-inquisition.
- The changes include replacing OP_CHECK{IN, OUT}CONTRACTVERIFY with OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY and introducing a flags parameter.
- With OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY and OP_CAT, MATT achieves full generality, but additional opcodes may be beneficial.

active_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
active_posts.summary:
- The email suggests solutions to scale Lightning in a trust-free manner for casual users.
- Enabling simple covenants would allow millions of casual users to create Lightning channels.
- Implementing timeout-trees can improve Lightning scalability and usability for off-chain transactions.

active_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
active_posts.summary:
